lectures.title: Multilingual LLMs
lectures.description: Sebastian Ruder is a research scientist at Cohere, based in Berlin, Germany, working on building multilingual Large Language Models (LLMs). Previously, he was a researcher at Google DeepMind and completed his Ph.D. in Natural Language Processing and Deep Learning at the Insight Research Centre for Data Analytics.

speaker.name: Sebastian Ruder
speaker.description: Sebastian Ruder is a research scientist at Cohere specializing in multilingual LLMs, with previous experience at Google DeepMind.

lectures.title: Metrized Deep Learning
lectures.description: Jeremy Bernstein is a postdoctoral researcher at MIT's CSAIL, focusing on the mathematical foundations of natural and artificial intelligence.

speaker.name: Jeremy Bernstein
speaker.description: Jeremy Bernstein is a postdoctoral researcher at MIT, specializing in natural and artificial intelligence.

lectures.title: The Next AI Frontier: Can Neural Networks Master Abstract Relational Reasoning?
lectures.description: Bruno Ribeiro is a professor at Purdue University and works with machine learning, focusing on generalization to domains beyond those observed during training.

speaker.name: Bruno Ribeiro
speaker.description: Bruno Ribeiro is a professor at Purdue University, specializing in machine learning and generalization of models.

lectures.title: Multiresolution Image Representation using Neural Networks
lectures.description: Hallison Paz is a researcher in AI Graphics, combining artificial intelligence and computer graphics. He will present a neural network architecture for multiresolution signal representation.

speaker.name: Hallison Paz
speaker.description: Hallison Paz is a researcher in AI Graphics, co-creator of the Dynamic Programming channel, and an expert in computer graphics.

lectures.title: Generative Models for Biomolecular Prediction, Dynamics, and Design
lectures.description: Hannes Stärk is a Ph.D. student at MIT, working on generative models for biomolecules, exploring how these models can predict and design biomolecules.

speaker.name: Hannes Stärk
speaker.description: Hannes Stärk is a Ph.D. student at MIT focused on generative models for biomolecules.

lectures.title: Multilingual Language Models: Benefits and Barriers
lectures.description: Marzieh Fadaee is a senior research scientist at Cohere for AI, focusing on fundamental research in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and building multilingual language models.

speaker.name: Marzieh Fadaee
speaker.description: Marzieh Fadaee is a researcher at Cohere for AI, working on multilingual language models and co-leading the Aya initiative.

lectures.title: Graph Neural Networks
lectures.description: Petar Veličković is a senior researcher at Google DeepMind and an affiliate lecturer at the University of Cambridge, focusing on geometric deep learning and graph learning.

speaker.name: Petar Veličković
speaker.description: Petar Veličković is a senior researcher at Google DeepMind, specializing in geometric deep learning and graph learning.

lectures.title: An Introduction to Reinforcement Learning
lectures.description: Victor Ulisses Pugliese is a Ph.D. student in Computer Science at UNIFESP, focusing on reinforcement learning and optimization problems.

speaker.name: Victor Pugliese
speaker.description: Victor Pugliese is a Ph.D. student at UNIFESP, specializing in reinforcement learning and optimization.

lectures.title: Revisiting the Fundamentals of Deep Reinforcement Learning for Learning Continually
lectures.description: Marlos C. Machado is an assistant professor at the University of Alberta and a researcher in continuous reinforcement learning, focusing on generalization and sequential learning.

speaker.name: Marlos C. Machado
speaker.description: Marlos C. Machado is a professor at the University of Alberta, specializing in reinforcement learning and continuous learning.

lectures.title: Introduction to Topological Deep Learning
lectures.description: Mathilde Papillon is a Ph.D. candidate at the University of California, Santa Barbara, researching the intersection of computational and human perceptions of movement through deep learning.

speaker.name: Mathilde Papillon
speaker.description: Mathilde Papillon is a Ph.D. candidate at UC Santa Barbara, focused on deep learning and perception of movement.

lectures.title: João Guilherme Madeira Araújo
lectures.description: João Guilherme Madeira Araújo is a Computer Science student at the Institute of Mathematical and Computational Sciences, a medalist in over 30 knowledge olympiads, and co-founder of CodCad, a free programming education platform.

speaker.name: João Guilherme Madeira Araújo
speaker.description: Computer Science student at ICMC, medalist in more than 30 knowledge Olympiads and co-founder of CodCad.

lectures.title: Using Deep Learning to Detect Fake News
lectures.description: Rafael Geurgas Zavarizz is a postdoctoral researcher at Purdue University, where he used deep learning and NLP techniques to detect fake news during the pandemic.

speaker.name: Rafael Geurgas Zavarizz
speaker.description: Rafael Zavarizz is a postdoctoral researcher at Purdue University, specializing in deep learning and NLP for fake news detection.
